If the operation $x * y$ is defined by $x * y = (x+1)(y+1) - 1$, then which one of the following is FALSE?\\
\\
$\textbf{(A)} \ x * y = y *x$ for all real $x$ and $y$.\\
\\
$\textbf{(B)} \ x * (y + z) = ( x * y ) + (x * z)$ for all real $x,y,$ and $z$\\
\\
$\textbf{(C)} \ (x-1) * (x+1) = (x * x) - 1$ for all real $x$.\\
\\
$\textbf{(D)} \ x * 0 = x$ for all real $x$.\\
\\
$\textbf{(E)} \ x * (y * z) = (x * y) * z$for all real $x,y,$ and $z$.
